pullrequest.title: Adding non-const bracket operators and improving consistency between vector types

content.raw: The compiler always chooses the non-const version when possible. Const-qualified member functions are only called when the object that they're being called on is const-qualified. It wouldn't surprise me if coverage tests ignore const-qualified versions of functions when a non-const version is being tested, because otherwise you would need to explicitly const-qualify your class instances in order to test the const-qualified versions of functions.
content.html: The compiler always chooses the non-const version when possible. Const-qualified member functions are only called when the object that they're being called on is const-qualified. It wouldn't surprise me if coverage tests ignore const-qualified versions of functions when a non-const version is being tested, because otherwise you would need to explicitly const-qualify your class instances in order to test the const-qualified versions of functions.
